title: Cuomo Defends Fines for Hospitals Slow to Vaccinate for Covid-19
sub_head: New York governor calls speeding up distribution of shots a matter of life and death
body:
New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo defended his plan to accelerate Covid-19 vaccinations from criticism by some local elected officials after a slow rollout of the shots.
The Democratic governor said the state would begin fining hospitals that don’t administer their full allotment of doses by the end of the week. Health-care workers as well as residents and staff at long-term-care facilities like nursing homes are currently eligible for vaccination in New York.
Mr. Cuomo also publicly disclosed which hospital systems had distributed doses at the lowest rates.
“We embarrassed some hospitals that were slow performers,” he said at a news conference Tuesday. “If you are not doing your job with a vaccine that could be a matter of life and death, then people have a right to know.”
New York City’s public hospital network was near the bottom of the state’s ranking of health-care systems and vaccine distributions. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, also a Democrat, said Mr. Cuomo’s efforts were unproductive.
